div.p: Greetings. I wrote to you some time ago that, while I greatly delight in your letters, I am quite willing to allow you to consider your health and your occupations, and to write to me only when it is convenient and without trouble.

The same now, my most desired Mr. Bullinger, I repeat and even more so because, with your last letters, you included homilies on Daniel, with which I can entertain myself for several months, even if I receive nothing from you in the meantime. Therefore, I free you from that care and, as the saying goes, bid you to sleep on both ears...
